Candidate :  Ivan Chong  
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
  
Location:   South West - Bristol  
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
MEng Chemical Engineering with Industrial Experience University of Manchester Sept 2017 – June 
2021  
• Grade Attained: 1st Class  
• Top 20 in cohort and received BP Perry Book Award in first year  
• 73% for Design Project in first year that involved designing a process to efficiently produce 
Benzoic Acid  
• 77% for HAZOP Project in second year that involved assessing the safety and eff ective 
operation of a Monoethylene Glycol recovery process  
• 71% for Design Project in fourth year that involved the design of a plant that produces 1,4 -
Butanediol  
 
 
CARE ER SUMMARY  
 
Sept 2019 – Sept 2020 Edwards Vacuum (part of Atlas Copco)  
Position: Development Eng ineer/ I  
  
Candidate :  Ivan Chong  
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
  
Location:   South West - Bristol  
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
MEng Chemical Engineering with Industrial Experience University of Manchester Sept 2017 – June 
2021  
• Grade Attained: 1st Class  
• Top 20 in cohort and received BP Perry Book Award in first year  
• 73% for Design Project in first year that involved designing a process to efficiently produce 
Benzoic Acid  
• 77% for HAZOP Project in second year that involved assessing the safety and eff ective 
operation of a Monoethylene Glycol recovery process  
• 71% for Design Project in fourth year that involved the design of a plant that produces 1,4 -
Butanediol  
 
 
CARE ER SUMMARY  
 
Sept 2019 – Sept 2020 Edwards Vacuum (part of Atlas Copco)  
Position: Development Eng ineer/ Industrial Placement  
• Worked in the lab on the Edwards Atlas abatement system (an exhaust management solution 
with respect to the semiconductor industry) and tested new technologies  
• Analysed burner emissions from the system using an FTIR (Fourier  Transform Infrared 
Spectrometer) whilst changing system settings such as fuel flow, with the aim to optimise the 
abatement and improve DRE (Destruction and Removal Efficiency)  
• Conducted a thermal mapping experiment of a new type of nozzle with a thermal  break, with the 
aim to solve a customer blockage problem as a result of deposition within the nozzle due to 
heat loss  
• Tested the performance of a new burner liner and a foreign abatement system with regards to 
fluorine and nitrogen trifluoride abatement  respectively by utilising an FTIR and an 
electrochemical duct  
• Analysed data gathered with the assistance of Excel spreadsheets and presented findings in 
the form of a written report as well as a simplified PowerPoint presentation during monthly 
reviews  
• Set up and ran projects independently, troubleshooting technical issues and upholding 
health/safety standards whilst on -site especially with regards to the handling and transportation 
of harmful gases (fluorine and nitrogen trifluoride)  
• Gained practica l hands -on experience with the abatement system in the lab and whilst on the 
manufacturing line (shop floor) during induction  
 • Worked alongside colleagues and contractors as well as external suppliers in a professional 
manner and setting  
• Consistently co mpleted company work and university assignments such as final dissertation to 
a high -quality and within deadlines  
 
Aug – Sept 2018 MTT Shipping Sdn Bhd Port Klang, Malaysia  
Position:  Intern for Corporate Communications and Internal Auditing  
• Saved the company time  and resources by assisting the company in meeting the requirements 
set out by Bursa Malaysia (Malaysian stock exchange) pertaining to legislation  
• Drafted the company policy on Environmental, Social, and Corporate Governance based on 
internal information  of the company and research carried out on similar policies in other 
companies, as well as relevant legal documentation  
• Produced 2 manuals (set of procedures) based on approved company policies and created 
presentations for training purposes using Micro soft PowerPoint  
• Reviewed 8 standard operating procedures of different departments (Sales, Customer Service, 
Logistics) and checked that they were updated and reflected current practices  
• Developed critical and logical thinking on the procedures that wer e set and gained an insight on 
ways to improve them to make them as fail -proof as possible  
• Improved time -management and organisational skills because I had to handle multiple tasks at 
the same time, prioritising workload based on importance  
• Enhanced wr itten and verbal communication skills by working in teams with different people 
from different departments  
 
COMMENT  
 
Additional Skills  
 
Leadership:  
Head Prefect: Led the Prefectorial Board, organised meetings and hosted assemblies; Sports House 
Captain, Assistant F ootball Coach: Organised and led sports activities weekly  
 
Computer Skills:  
Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint; MATLAB (91% in 1st Year Module); Aspen HYSYS; Google 
Sketchup  
 
Public Speaking:  
Participated in various de

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
